title: RTutorial

metadata.description: Learn about RTutorial with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Learn R
R is a programming language.
R is often used for statistical computing and graphical presentation to analyze 
  and visualize data.
Start learning R now »
Examples in Each Chapter
With our "
Example
How to output some text, and how to do a simple calculation in R:
"Hello World!"
5 + 5
Result:
[1] "Hello World!"
[1] 10

Example
How you can use R to easily create a graph with 
numbers from 1 to 10 on both the x and y axis:
plot(1:10)
Result:

We recommend reading this tutorial, in the sequence listed in the left menu.
R Exercises
Test Yourself With Exercises
Exercise:
Insert the missing part of the code below to output "Hello World".
Hello World
Submit Answer »
Start the Exercise
R Quiz
Learn by taking a quiz! This quiz will give you a signal of how much you know about R.
Take the R Quiz
R Examples
Learn by examples! This tutorial supplements all explanations with clarifying examples.
See All R Examples

quiz.question: What is R?
options:
often used for statistical computing and graphical presentation to analyze 
  and visualize data
quiz.explanation:
The correct definition of R is 'often used for statistical computing and graphical presentation to analyze 
  and visualize data'.

summary: This tutorial covers RTutorial concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use RTutorial effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of RTutorial and how to apply it in your projects.
